subject_terms_3: Force 136 (Guerilla movement) Tan, Chong Tee 1942-1945 Japanese occupation
physical_appearance: This is a certificate from the St. John Ambulance Association. The certificate is printed in landscape orientation. There is a logo on the top left of the certificate, and a decorative letter below it. The name is written in black ink, with a chinese name written in blue ink on its left. The date is signed at the bottom. There is an orange border around the edge of the certificate. The certificate is slightly smudged in places.
sgcool_label_text:
This certificate belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya
title_text: Tan Chong Tee Collection: Certificate from The St. John Ambulance Association ?????
